Greetings all,

	Just to let you know that the reason I've been a bit quiet lately is 
I was busy finding myself a new job.

	That's all done now, and I started with this lot: 
http://www.navisworks.com/ on Tuesday.  So far they seem unreasonably nice :)

	w.r.t SLEAT, I spent some time putting a ES-style (*) variance 
parameters into it.  They don't seem to make much difference to the 
search, but that mean they are not killing it either.  And they are 
driven down to low values in old (and hence required) genes...  I put 
them on all weights and also all FIDs.

	(*do I mean ES?  I get abbreviation blindness sometimes)

	Generally, SLEAT runs fine up to the point where the PPS fitness 
(see my previous discussions) reaches about 90%.  Then it really 
starts to slow (never quite stopping, but how would I know...) and by 
the time it gets to around 92% the search is so slow that it becomes 
impractical to continue...

	How does that gel with folk's experience on similar problems?  e.g. 
diminishing returns I expect, but it is a _very_ steep slope at this 
end of the problem space...  e.g. typical timings go something like:

to 75% - 5 mins
to 80% - 2 hours
to 85% - 10 hours
to 90% - 20 hours
to 92% - 50 hours...

	I don't have exact timings (and there were other things running at 
the same time anyway), but I'll try to get a graph of fitness vs. 
cycles (1 cycle = 1 birth/death) in a day or two...

	Ian

p.s. and a happy new year.
In 15 minutes everybody will be in the future.
